Topic: Draw reversible and irreversible changes (ice melting vs. egg cooking)
CAN: The student can draw ice and label it as a solid before heating.
The student can attempt to illustrate the melting of ice and label the water formed, though the depiction might be simplistic.
The student may include a basic claim about reversibility, such as 'ice can turn back to solid,' though the explanation might lack clarity.
CANNOT: The student may not clearly illustrate an egg being heated into a solid form, possibly omitting details of the cooking process *(may confuse with other processes)*.
The student is likely unable to accurately depict or label post-cooking characteristics of the egg *(does not understand irreversibility concept)*.
The student may struggle to annotate their claim about reversibility, especially for the egg, due to insufficient understanding of irreversible changes.
